articles.description:
Added: support an experimental template for YouTube feed ğŸ“º Demo | Source

Aggregate content from any YouTube channel rss url https://www.youtube.com/feeds/videos.xml?channel_id=<replace_with_channel_id>
Videos are embedded via iframe and loading accelerated by youtube-lite-embed
Ads are reduced thanks to YouTube's policy for embedded videos ğŸ™ƒ
Works on mobile devices with butter smooth horizontal scroll.
Caveat: the template works only with YouTube content. You cannot mix textual RSS feed or other video sources such as Vimeo.
Changed: Default HTML template meta tag adjusted to match convention
Changed: sources in template data is now ordered by last update timestamp (as opposed to alphabetical)
Thank you @PiyushLosalka

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alba Silvente)
articles.description: In this article, we will look at when it makes sense to migrate from a monolithic project to a headless setup and the benefits that come with it. In addition to a step-by-step guide on how to migrate WordPress to Storyblok Headless CMS, the problems that will arise during the process and how to deal with them.

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Colby Fayock)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Marcus Herrmann)
articles.description: Web app accessibility appears difficult because it seems that there is little information on the subject available online. Letâ€™s take a closer look at the accessible use of framework features, concrete Vue.js traits, as well as community initiatives and vetted patterns.
articles.title: Three Insights I Gained While Researching Vue.js Accessibility

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cassidy Williams)
articles.description: There are two strategies for incrementally building websites that are growing in popularity: Incremental Static Regeneration and Distributed Persistent Rendering. Whatâ€™s the difference? Letâ€™s figure it out.
articles.title: ISR vs DPR: Big Words, Quick Explanation

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Zara Cooper)
articles.description: In this article, youâ€™ll get to see some pretty groundbreaking things you can achieve with modern JavaScript grids and discover new ways to augment a data grid to make it engaging, responsive, and accessible. All this will be illustrated using Kendo UI Data Grids and their features.
articles.title: You Can Do That With A JavaScript Data Grid?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Too often dealing with filters can be frustrating. Letâ€™s get them right. That means never freeze the UI on a single input, provide text input fallback and never auto-scroll users on a single input. Hereâ€™s why.
articles.title: Frustrating Design Patterns: Broken Filters

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Michelle Barker)
articles.description: In JavaScript, attaching an event listener to constantly fire a callback on scroll can be performance-intensive. But there is a better way with Intersection Observer.
articles.title: Building A Dynamic Header With Intersection Observer

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Facundo Giuliani)
articles.description: In this article, weâ€™re taking a closer look at different approaches and strategies on how we can migrate a web application that uses jQuery framework, and start using one of the coolest React frameworks in the market: Next.js.
articles.title: How To Migrate From jQuery To Next.js

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: CSS refactoring is not an easy task â€” it needs to be done in a way that doesn't create problems. articles.title: Refactoring CSS: Introduction (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Todd Libby)
articles.description: Accessibility is often overlooked or bolted on to the end of a project. Letâ€™s figure out how to implement and advocate for accessibility from the inception of a project to the release or handoff and beyond.
articles.title: Making A Strong Case For Accessibility

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Uma Victor)
articles.description: Even though Vue.js claims to have an approachable minimalist framework that can be incrementally adaptable, it can be a little bit overwhelming when starting as a Vue.js newbie. In this article, weâ€™re looking at ways to make writing Vue.js a breeze.
articles.title: Tools And Practices To Speed Up The Vue.js Development Process

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Emiliano Cicero)
articles.description: Interactive Components in Figma allows designers to create a component with states (hover, active, clicked, focus) and make it interactive so that every copy of the component will inherit those same interactions by default. articles.title: An Introduction To Figma Interactive Components

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Emmanuel Tissera)
articles.description: There is an array of Headless CMSes out there. In this article, we delve into headless CMS features to satisfy your content editors, marketers and yourself as a developer. articles.title: How To Choose A Headless CMS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ahmad Shadeed)

articles.title: Using HSL Colors In CSS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andriy Zapisotskyi)
articles.description: With so many tools and approaches, email still has quite a few pain points, both for developers and email marketers. Email is difficult because it has too many aspects to set and a few instances with no common rules to follow.
articles.title: Email Testing Flow As It Should Be

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ramona Schwering)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Surma)
articles.description: The web is single-threaded. This makes it increasingly hard to write smooth and responsive apps. Workers have a bad rep, but can be an important and useful tool in any web developer's toolbelt for these kinds of problems. Letâ€™s get up to speed on Workers on the Web!
articles.title: The State Of Web Workers In 2021

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)

articles.title: Breaking Down Bulky Builds With Netlify And Next.js

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)

articles.title: Creating Custom Emmet Snippets In VS Code

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Dom Habersack)

articles.title: Creating A Multi-Author Blog With Next.js

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Mark Lankmilier)
articles.description: This article is a case study of how a UX audit affects a UI. It explains how a famous educational platform can be analyzed edX against Jakob Nielsenâ€™s usability guidelines. To get started, Mark Lankmiller shares all of the criteria and metrics he used for his UX audit.
articles.title: How To Run A UX Audit For A Major EdTech Platform (Case Study)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Josh Singer)
articles.description: In the dynamic and unpredictable environments in which we work, even the most carefully crafted solutions can have a short shelf life. When we accept that our work is impermanent and our problem-solving abilities are limited, our goal can shift from delivering full solutions to developing tools that empower our users to adaptively design for themselves.
articles.title: The Rise Of Design Thinking As A Problem Solving Strategy

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Iris LjeÅ¡njanin)
articles.description: Frontend and design are remarkably complex these days. articles.title: Smashing Online Workshops (July-October 2021)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cameron Cundiff)
articles.description: Automated testing is an important part of any software project, including testing for accessibility. Since I hadnâ€™t seen this before, I set out to build Auto VO, a driver for the VoiceOver screen reader.
articles.title: Automating Screen Reader Testing On macOS Using Auto VO

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (MikoÅ‚aj Dobrucki)
articles.description: After years of innovation in both tools and processes, the struggle between design and development is still real. This article focuses on the best practices for improving the design to development processes and how cutting-edge solutions, such as UXPin powered by Merge technology, can help in facilitating the change.
articles.title: Designing With Code: A Modern Approach To Design (Development Challenges)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ayobami Ogundiran)
articles.description: Do you have to process data manually because it is served through images or scanned documents? An image-to-text conversion makes it possible to extract text from images to automate the processing of texts on images, videos, and scanned documents. In this article, we look at how to convert an image to text with React and Tesseract.js(OCR), preprocess images, and deal with the limitations of Tesseract (OCR).
